intro: Scheelea princeps var. corumbaensis, commonly known as the Corumbá palm, is a species of palm native to Brazil. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate leaves that can reach several meters in length. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, followed by elongated, cylindrical fruits containing a single seed. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in wetlands and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
